intro: Elsholtzia minima, commonly known as the dwarf elsholtzia, is a small perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants such as mint and sage. The plant is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of tiny, pale blue to violet flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and alpine settings. Its compact size and fragrant foliage make it a desirable addition to botanical collections.
